description: Removal of condition 8 to ref: 25/00058/FUL to allow occupation without a Certificate of Compliance in accordance with Secured by Design Homes Guide 2024.
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates must be begun not later than the expiration of three years beginning from the date of the decision notice ref: 25/00058/FUL.Reason: To comply with the provisions of S.51 of the Planning & Compulsory Purchase Act 2004.

The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the approved plans, as set out in the attached schedule which forms part of this notice.Location PlanE001E002E003E004E005P001P002P003P004P005D001Planning StatementReason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning.

The use of the property as a House in Multiple Occupation hereby approved shall be occupied by a maximum of 7 people at any one time acting as a single household and shall not be subdivided or occupied as self-contained units. Reason: To accord with the stipulations of definition as a House of Multiple Occupation and to safeguard the residential character of the surrounding area.
No independent cooking or laundry facilities shall be installed in any of the respective bedrooms and the communal kitchen / dining room and communal bathroom shall be retained in perpetuity.

Prior to occupation, the covered and secured cycle parking, as indicated on the approved plans for ref- 25/00058/FUL shall be installed and ready for use. They cycle parking shall be maintained as such thereafter.Reason: To ensure the provision of cycle parking in line with the Council's adopted standards.

Notwithstanding the approved plans, prior to the occupation, refuse and recycling storage facilities must be provided within the development, in accordance with the Enfield Council's Waste and Recycling Storage Planning Guidance (available at https://www.enfield.gov.uk/__data/assets/pdf_file/0015/5091/waste-and-recycling-storage-planningguidance- planning.pdf).Reason: In the interests of amenity and the recycling of waste materials in support of the Borough's waste reduction targets.

No structure or erection exceeding 0.6 metres in height shall be placed within 2 metres from either side of the access point.Reason: To safeguard vulnerable road users including pedestrians and to ensure vehicles are able to see the whole footway clearly when exiting the premises having regard to the more intensive use proposed.
